metadata.Title: CVE-2019-5439 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A Buffer Overflow in VLC Media Player < 3.0.7 causes a crash which can possibly be further developed into a remote code execution exploit.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-5439` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvlc-bin - 3.0.7-1
libvlc5 - 3.0.7-1
libvlccore9 - 3.0.7-1
vlc - 3.0.7-1
vlc-bin - 3.0.7-1
vlc-data - 3.0.7-1
vlc-l10n - 3.0.7-1
vlc-plugin-access-extra - 3.0.7-1
vlc-plugin-base - 3.0.7-1
vlc-plugin-fluidsynth - 3.0.7-1
vlc-plugin-jack - 3.0.7-1
vlc-plugin-notify - 3.0.7-1
vlc-plugin-qt - 3.0.7-1
vlc-plugin-samba - 3.0.7-1
vlc-plugin-skins2 - 3.0.7-1
vlc-plugin-svg - 3.0.7-1
vlc-plugin-video-output - 3.0.7-1
vlc-plugin-video-splitter - 3.0.7-1
vlc-plugin-visualization - 3.0.7-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vlc package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.7-1').
